featured.text: Wherever football is played, the players learn the rough-and-tumble lesson that only through the 34 of each member can the team win.
But baby elephants, not used to negotiating rough ground, may easily fall into the trenches and get hurt; and once injured, they might not be able to climb out.
He saw a man with a hole in the leg of his trousers and 29 realized what Californians 30 for the rough work they were doing—good, strong trousers! 21.

definition.zh_def: 表面不平滑或不均勻的；粗糙的。
definition.en_def: Having an uneven or irregular surface; not smooth.
definition.example: The rough surface of the stone made it difficult to walk on.
